title: Quiet Cabinet Drawer Stops
summary: Stop drawers from slamming and protect cabinet frames with simple adhesive bumpers and felt pads.

fitCheck.question: Do your drawers hit the cabinet frame when closing?
Is there a flat surface inside the drawer front?

kit.name: Clear cabinet bumper pads
kit.why: Soft landing to reduce impact noise.

kit.name: Surface prep wipes
kit.why: Improve adhesive grip on wood finishes.

steps: Clean the inside corners of the drawer frame with prep wipes.
Place bumper pads on the inside frame where the drawer front meets.
Add felt pads to the drawer front if you need more cushioning.
Close the drawer slowly and adjust pad placement for an even stop.
mistakes: Skipping surface cleaning can cause pads to fall off.
Over-stacking pads can prevent drawers from closing fully.

faqs.q: Will the pads damage the finish?
faqs.a: Most adhesive pads remove cleanly when pulled slowly at a low angle.
